concept.title: Command Scope
concept.shortdesc: A command may have a scope as an argument. A comman's scope is delimited by curly braces ({ and }) after the command.

example.p: Commands that accept scope use curly brackets to define that scope.
example.codeblock: \command_name{This is the scope of the command.}

section.title: Special behavior for font switching.
section.p: Font switches use a slightly different behavior in that they affect all of the text in the current scope, up to the next font switch or the end of the scope.

link.desc: Each ConTeXt command must have a name, and may also take setups (either as keywords, keyval pairs, or sets of each) and can have a scope.
